metadata.title: Alaska Mammal Collection

creators.name: University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF), University of Alaska Museum

metadata.description: Data Type: Mammals;  The Mammal Collection database contains records for 34,000 University of Alaska Museum specimens, most of which are from Alaska. Data include the kinds of information typically associated  with museum specimens, i.e. taxonomic identity, locality, date, measurements, reproductive condition etc. The format of this data is compatible with the Network for Information Retrieval in Mammalogy. This database is intended to support and facilitate use of the Mammal Collection, not as a substitute for specimen-based-research. Therefore, citation of specimen data implies that the researcher has examined the specimens.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Unknown

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: Responses to routine inquires about the mammal data are provided free of charge. Written requests are required to specify the intended use of the data. User must review and sign a Data Use Policy stating data use provisions.

Use constraints: Users agree to notify the University of Alaska Museum
